Articles.Content:
Floor 5110

You saw T Series again...yeah...you better run...

2 hours ago, Barzon Kerman said:

Floor 5110:
A diagram shows that infact, the building is still entirely inside the atmosphere.

Logically, the ceiling height ehich could acimmodate westerns musy be around 2.5m, am I correct? (Well because we SEA people are shorter that we might make it under a 2m ceiling height)

Just done some maths, if "You" is either a Western or a Southeast Asian.

  • 2.5m × 5110 = 12775m
  • 2m × 5110 = 10220m

So Mount Everest is approx. 10km, Spy Planes spy at around 20.

Edited April 16, 2019 by FahmiRBLXian
Thats still only 13km

Just checked that and that's just shy of Spy Plane's reconnaissance altitude, but higher than Mount Everest.

But since earlier post states that some floors have higher ceilings (i.e the existense of a Black Hole,Aircraft Hangar, Food Courts, Auditoriums, etc.), I think the building still reached the edge of Thermosphere.

If so, the statements in earlier posts that an LEO satellite collided with the building, Jeb riding his SRB, etc. could make sense. Even a 747 could ram into this building. Any higher to even reach the Sun might be around a million floors, using the minimal head clearence height for Westerns.

Edited April 16, 2019 by FahmiRBLXian
5112: A narrator's voice saying, "When Stanley came to a set of stairs, he climbed up and got on with the game.
5113 : A rotating food court, similar with the one at KL (Kuala Lumpur) Tower. You said "I'm done" and went for a meal there.
5113: you hungrily sit down, only to realize this is Jeb's Diner, and you hurry up the stairs.
5114: Food. You eat it.
5115: The same diner, except everything is food BUT the food. Yummy.

5116: Maintenance

Just my luck ending up on a boring floor . . . .

%!!&:

THE WRITER HAS BEEN HOLDING DOWN SHIFT TOO MUCH!!!!!!!!

5118;

the writer forgot to press shift.

5119:

an "empty floor", when you try to walk in you bump in to a painting.

2^9×10

There are 2^n writings in the wall

5121: This floor consists of a single, completely empty room, which has a single balcony. The balcony platform allows you to look far. The sky's color is blue-green, which gives a rather strange feeling. More familiar white clouds roll beneath you, but the surface, if there is even any, is invisible. Strangely, the air is breathable, despite what your common sense says.

You wondered if this building's floors are even actually connected physically. Observation from this room suggests otherwise, with the entire building above you appearing to be a tall, slender pillar with no visible feature. No windows, no balconies, no variation in size, not even difference in colors. It's like you're in some sort of limbo, but after everything you've experienced, you don't really mind this floor's peculiarity.

Just as you turned back towards the staircase, you caught a glimpse of a person running down the stairway. You swore you saw your own face in that split second the figure rushed past. Nevertheless, you decided to ignore them and continue upwards.

Edited April 17, 2019 by Hypercosmic

5121: a room with a mirror and trash cans, when you try to interact with the mirror, your reflection jumps out, yells "I'm free!" and jumps in a trashcan which then disappears. Some how there are still the same number of trash cans in this room. Confused, you decide to leave.  

Spoiler

If it's not obvious the trash cans some how travel through time.  

 

Edited April 17, 2019 by lunardog15

5123: A poster on the wall details the last two floors. Scribbled on it in true Doug Rattmann fashion is "I love this kind of stuff!" Then a huge Aperture Laboratories logo crashes through the ceiling, followed by Wheatley and the Space Core (pls next poster have the person do something with Wheatley). You carry them up to floor 5124 where you find...

Floor 5124: You notice that Wheatley﻿﻿ is in GLaDOS has token over the ENTIRE facility (Including Aperture Science innovators).  Now looking at the situation normally, it looks impossible for you to get out. You realise that you will only do one test chamber as they go one floor down (illegal move) or go one floor up. The first one he gives you was a very easy test and you are able to get to the next floor.
5125: Lots and lots of goo, all kinds. You shoot a portal at some nearby white goo and find that there is already an open portal on the next floor

@The_Arcitect @Fraston Thx for humoring me, I appreciate it.

Let's see how long we can get this going for:

5126: A room full of identical copies of the Space Core, with a broken crusher in it. You can tell what this room was for. You hurry up to the next floor before you can ensure if the crusher is actually broken.
5127 : Kevin MacLeod's (Hypothetical) first EDM Concert, featuring his first (Hypothetical) Electrnic Dance, Future Bass song which is a hit, more than Martin Garrix's Animals.

5128

Spoiler
Spoiler

 

  : (    booty    : (  

 

Edited April 20, 2019 by Guest

5129

You saw PewDiePie in person, talked to him for 3 Hours before leaving him...
5130 Turrets singing opera. You listen for a few minutes before remembering that this isn't "Listen To Turrets Sing", it's "Really Really Really Tall Building", and you walk up to the next floor.
5131... CUBICLES *gasp* you quickly hurry up the stairs, trying to remember why they didn't install an elevator... and what floor your interview's on.
